Summary: Email One-Time Code for Password Reset
Description: Implement a feature allowing users to reset their password using a one-time code sent via email.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User receives an email with a one-time code for password reset.
The one-time code expires after 10 minutes.
User can reset the password using a valid one-time code.

Description: Develop positive and negative test cases for OTP verification during password reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Test case for successful OTP verification is created.
Test case for expired OTP is created.
Test case for invalid OTP is created.

Summary: Rate Limiting for Password Reset Attempts
Description: Implement rate limiting to restrict password reset attempts to a maximum of 3 per hour per user.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User cannot request more than 3 password reset attempts per hour.
System displays an error message after exceeding the limit.
Rate limit resets after one hour.

Summary: Audit Event for Successful Password Reset
Description: Send an audit event to the logs when a password is successfully reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Audit event is generated upon successful password reset.
Audit event includes user ID and timestamp.
Audit event is accessible in the system logs.

Summary: Regression Testing for Existing Login Flow
Description: Conduct regression tests to ensure the existing login flow remains unaffected by the new password reset feature.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Existing login functionality is tested and verified.
No new issues are introduced in the login flow.
Regression test results are documented.
